JSON::datatype

JSON::datatype Namespace Reference

A wrapper namespace to stop the datatype enum from polluting the JSON namespace. This also helps with IDE Auto-completion somewhat. More...

 the different datatypes that a value can hold. More...

Detailed Description

A wrapper namespace to stop the datatype enum from polluting the JSON namespace. This also helps with IDE Auto-completion somewhat.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum JSON::datatype::dt

the different datatypes that a value can hold.

While the specification only defines one numeric type, we try to be clever and leverage the advantages of stronger numeric types by defining _number and _fixed_number. _fixed_number is an integer type, while _number is a double. conversion between the two is fairly free-and-easy.

Enumerator:
_undefined 
_string 
_unquoted_string  An unquoted-string occurs when an object member name is not quoted properly, this is surprisingly common: e.g. { a : "b" } is strictly invalid, and should be: {'a' : "b"}
_literal 
_number 
_fixed_number
